actions.text: On agreeing to the McCollum amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.

description: Amendment requires that the first $650 million of authorized funds for State "truth-in-sentencing" prison grants be reserved for the purpose of reimbursing States for the costs of incarcerating criminal aliens, beginning in fiscal year 1996 and continuing until fiscal year 2000.
purpose: An amendment to provide full reimbursement to states for the costs incurred for the incarceration of criminal aliens. The amendment would direct the Attorney General to reserve up to $650 million in funds appropriated for Truth in Sentencing Grants to fund the payments.
